item.title: The creation wizard for the forecaster database has failed. We apologize for the inconvenience.
item.description: Setting up a new database in Forecaster is usually simple. You just open the Forecaster Database Creation Wizard, connect to your SQL Server, input the database details, and you’re done. However, recently I encountered a problem where the wizard unexpectedly stopped working after I named the new database. This happened on multiple computers, but interestingly, creating the database on a different SQL Server worked fine. After checking the Application Event Log, I found a vague .

item.title: The application configuration is incorrect, causing the VS 2008 .NET 3.5 Integration Error and preventing the application from starting.
item.description: After deploying a new .NET integration for Dynamics GP, a “failed to start” error message appeared upon launching the application on the client’s server. Event log entries indicated “Syntax error in manifest or policy file” and “The application failed to launch because of an invalid manifest.” Previous .NET integrations developed with Visual Studio 2005 and .NET 2.0 worked correctly. However, this integration used Visual Studio 2008, .NET 3.5, and .NET LINQ extensions.
